H0.text: A compound is a description of air, which is composed of nitrogen, oxygen, and other gases.

H1.text: An element is a description of air, which is composed of nitrogen, oxygen, and other gases.

H2.text: Air can be described as a mixture because it is composed of nitrogen, oxygen, and other gases.

H3.text: A molecule is a description of air based on its composition of nitrogen, oxygen, and other gases.

A4.text: dry air contains 78.08% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.93% argon, 0.04% carbon dioxide, and small amounts of other trace gases

A5.text: The atmosphere consists of a layer of mixed gas (commonly referred to as air) that is retained by gravity, surrounding the Earth's surface
